On june 19, 2012
Pause

Welcome to the questions thread!


Use this thread for any small questions you have, number each question like this 'Q12', 'Q13'.
When answering a question mention it's number like this 'A12', 'A13'.
This will make the questions easier to follow.

Example:
Player A:
Q21: "How can I get more recruits?"

Player B:
A21: "Try using the thread named 'Recruit of the heart'"

Please try to be patient, questions are not always answered in order. Wait until somebody answers your question.

If things become too complicated feel free to repost any question again in it's own thread.

Thanks

On june 20, 2012
Doomys

A2: Well we know that the amphetamine shot gives +100% overall speed. Not movement speed. So those two types of speed do exist but not everyone agrees on which skills are movement speed and which skills are overall speed.

MY OBSERVATIONS
(what speed skills do what based on what I have seen)

Movement speed skills:
Sprinter, huge calves, heavy armor (slows down), heavyweight (slows down), sturdy (if he has heavy weapons).

Overall speed skills:
Amphetamine shot, wife beater, Thermos of coffee, hurry, hyperactive, survival instinct, enthusiastic.

Every movement skill has been classified. Feel free to debate my choices. I want to see what other people think.

On june 25, 2012
SilentPinoy

A4(2): The chance for a killshot? It depends and not exactly.

If you like to aim for the appendages of course you won't get a killshot. Of course aiming for a vital spot(any target of the axial body frame) will increase the odds of hitting those 1HKO targets.

They increase the odds of aiming for a specific spot for use of skills(ie Heartbreaker if aiming for the Heart) to activate. As well as repeatedly hitting a spot on a target (which dealing damage to the same spot on a target will deal more damage).

If you need a point of reference:

Hitting the head deals double damage(Full Metal Balaclave cancels this)
Hitting the torso region also chances deal a fatal shot and in my theory causes action speed to decrease noted by heavy breathing.(Bulletproof Vest protects this)
Both armor also decreases fatal shots by 50%

Hitting the legs decreases movement and action speed.
Hitting arms has a chance to disarm.

Of course just because you aim for a region doesn't mean it will be hit.

You can only create 2 recruits to any army ever (Unless you have dynamic IP). But, if you delete your flash player data and cookies you can create 3 recruits a day. Though you are still limited to only 2 recruits per one army ever (Unless you have dynamic IP).

On july 3, 2012
Kompera

Waaaay back in the day when I worked for a regional ISP, any customer who didn't pay for a static IP (so that they could host services such as their own web page, etc.) was assigned a dynamic IP upon connection. The easiest way to get a new IP was to disconnect and reconnect. But, that was the days of dial-up Internet.

For broadband, always on connections, the ISP sets an IP upon first connection (typically via DHCP), and this IP has a timeout which is set by the ISP. So getting a new IP is a matter of waiting out the timer. You might be able to force this by issuing (Windows OS) ipconfig /release -> ipconfig /renew, but I don't know if that will force a change. I'm unable to test, as I ride the broadband provided by my landlord and I have no access to the gateway.

I usually cannot participate (again) in the RotH unless I know that there's been a power outage or a few weeks time has passed. Either the timeout expires or the reset of the gateway forces a new IP to be assigned. Trying to force a new IP address from my computer would do me no good, as MY IP address assigned by the gateway may be changed, but the NATted IP address presented to Twinoid is that of the gateway, and not mine.

If you click on any kind of flash animation and choose open settings you'll find an option for deleting any stored data. There will be a tab for data storage. Simply delete all data and you should be good to go.

4. you can now see your recruits at the bottom of the page.
5. Click on the recruit you want and then, click on the army name (left of the page)

Hope it's clear enough.

Does anyone know how Vicious works? Is the aim point chosen at the start of aiming (when the target is acquired) or when the shot is actually taken?

Glad you asked, I just made a vicious themed army a few days ago. I already understand how it works. It's not such a bad skill after all .

Here is an example of how it works with assault rifles:
http://sir.vicious.minitroopers.com/b...

1. First burst is fired. Targets hitted: left leg, right lung.
2. Second burst is fired. Targets hitted: left leg and right lung again.

Conclusion: the first burst will hit any body parts but the second burst's shots will only hit the body parts hit by the first burst.

I still have more testing to do.

On july 29, 2012
MoistNugget

Q1 - How do u turn a regular replay with bat1 or mis1 into a replay with numbers at the ending which is reusable?

Thanks, Moist Nugget.
On july 29, 2012
pickupsticks

You can't change a replay that has already happened.
The ones with numbers at the end are only made when you type in the name of the person you want to fight.
If you want to make all your replays into ones that you can keep then don't click on the "attack" button in the choices you are offered each day, copy the name of the person you are going to fight into the "Select an army base to infiltrate:" box and press the "infiltrate" button instead.

NB: attacking armies in this way makes them more likely to appear in your own infiltrate missions.
On july 29, 2012
45424

This is the only way to actively place armies in your infiltration mission waiting list.

On july 31, 2012
Kompera

s4njiIt is quite vague, I don't see a box to fill in this "Infiltrate bar"? >_>
Also, so you can't copy / make a permanent version of all but infiltrate missions?
You must reach a high enough level to make permanent battle links?
1) From your Minitrooper army HQ, press one of the three "PICK A FIGHT!" buttons you are offered daily. They are labeled "GO!" if you have yet to undertake the mission.
2) On the next screen, you are offered your choice of several armies to challenge, or to enter in an army to Infiltrate.
See image here.
3) The URL for this Infiltration is what you can use to share with others the resulting fight.

To answer your 2nd and 3rd questions:
Correct. You can copy the URL for Exterminate or Epic missions, but if others do not view them that day (before server midnight) they'll lose the opportunity forever.
No, you can capture URLs from Infiltrate missions starting with a single L1 Trooper.

See image here.

On august 27, 2012
dsci
mtkillsQ: how can i get more recruits?, i now only get 10 coin from every new recruit and in the forum "Recruit of the Heat" it is a give and get system and their is a 2 per-day limit of creating new accounts

I have dynamic IP - it's not a solving of the problem. Dynamic means you have not one static IP-address, but every session of your internet browsing your host makes for you temporary IP-address. You can create two recruits, then restart your internet session - restart modem and delete private data of your browser.
In theory, if you VERY want have many recruits - it really helps. But on practice that means you need do too much stuff for pair of new recruits. Additionally sometimes you get the same IP-address, you already had - every host has for dynamic IPs some limited range of addresses, so, eventually free IPs run out, and you can't do that trick.
But this way only for hardgamers and noreallifers) Or it's me so lazy I don't do that) I had 24 free addresses, so, I added 25 recruits. Annually my host refreshes IPs, so, I have another IP's range for recruits.
Now I have near 70 recruits - ~50 mine and ~20 added with real people in ROH-thread. As for me ROH-threads convenient because I need not to do a lot of stuff for pair of recruits (yes, I'm lazy one, even I have possibility to clone recruits as Dollys). So, visit more often ROH-threads and you will have enough soldiers. You just need more time.

On october 10, 2012
mogman

It's an ad block thing... Ad block removes that horribly instrusive ad and the css isn't adaptive enough to deal with the sudden removal... When I turn ad block off the ad comes back and everything moves to where it should be.


You are absolutely positioning elements within elements that have no positioning set. Bad css practice. If you instead of using image tags to place backgrounds, use the background of the div tags you will run into less problems. OR surround the image + text in a relatively positioned div at which point your absolute positioning will only work as though its container were the window.


This CSS lesson brought to you by mog.

On october 10, 2012
mogman
Pausethanks M!
...hmmm? or... what if I used absolute positioning for everything!

Then you would have to absolute position based on percentages and such which is infinitely harder. Why would you have to use percentages? Because 300px is different on 1028x768 resolution compared to 1260x926 or whatever it is... Sometimes (often) you just have to let the browser control it with relative elements. If you are going to be stubborn about absolute everything, just give up and use a table.

On october 10, 2012
mogman
coro

BURN ALL THE ABSOLUTELY POSITIONED ELEMENTS

BURN THEM ALL

So make a big banner image and somehow use margins to position a clickable button inside? Yea ok, have fun with that. I would only agree with your statement if they were poorly done absolute elements.


coroBTW, tables are already in use. I don't think you need tables for a layout like this, just nested divs. And lots of floating. Loooots of floating
The table is wrapped around a bunch of top crap at the top that can be in it's own table or container... whatever. The main body of the content is pretty much the definition of a table structure... 3-4 rows, 2 columns (1 column at about 35% width the other at about 60% width) let the elements inside the cells dictate the height... Divs and floating are really just a NEED for higher understanding in css when all it really needs is a table structure which is BASIC HTML. Don't over complicate where its not needed.


Note for when you are teaching people, take into account the level of knowledge they currently have and SLOWLY integrate higher level techniques. Floating elements is a pain in the ass at the best of times...

On december 1, 2012
pickupsticks

It is only possible to password protect your own army. If he has made a recruit under your army then it is his recruit to do with as he pleases. To avoid this problem either make all your recruits for yourself, use the recruitment thread at different times of the day so that he does not follow you, find a friendly person to act as a "trading partner" and exchange recruits in private messages away from the forum, make use of the specialist recruit thread, or just accept that you'll end up with less than helpful recruits. Treat them as cannon fodder, build better recruits when you can.
If you are being sent abusive messages through the forums then this is something that you can report. If your troopers have abusive or racist names then there's not much that you can do about that, unfortunately. Everyone has their share of troopers that they would rather did not exist, these days.

On february 16, 2013
pickupsticks

Someone with more technical knowledge than me might be able to help (or there might already be an answer up on the wiki - have you checked the wiki? There's a link in one of the sticky threads) but the above caveat notwithstanding:

As I understand it, problems with password creation are because you have the amount of memory for flash cookies set to zero, you have your regular cookies disabled, or you have taken too long to try to set the password and now your IP has changed.
Poking some of the settings might help you, but there's a good chance that you've missed your chance for that particular army.

Note: that's as far as my knowledge goes, I'm not a technically minded person. Maybe someone else can confirm/add to/ridicule what I've said here.

Also see this one of the sticky threads: http://twinoid.com/en/tid/forum#!view... for general troubleshooting.

No, having pilot does NOT increase your chances of unlocking vehicles on higher levels. Pilot only increases your chances of deployment by this formula: (This is only a theory)

D(1.25)^X-1

Where D is the vehicle's default deployment rate (which is unknown) and X is the pilot's level.
On march 16, 2013
Doomys

But I'm not sure this theory is true because that would mean that if the helicopter has a default deployment chance of 2%, a level 15 pilot with helicopter would have 45.47% chance to deploy in his helicopter. And a level 19 pilot would be 100% sure to deploy in his chopper.

The other option is that the formula doesn't work like compound interest but more like simple interest:

D(1.25+(X-1))

Which seems like a more simple equation and maybe more realistic because if the pilot+helicopter (with default % chance to spawn)

And it worked for me

MarcotonioIs there any assured explanation on Brick S***house? The wikipage let me kinda confused.

Brick S__t gives +3 LP; we all know that. And pickupsticks is right. Is all about Line of Sight. I wrote somethings on wikia about LoS, and I'm going to post what I think about it, ok?

Think about a guy Aiming. There are two kinds of bullets: bullets that hits, and bullets that misses. The ways to miss some bullets are: low Aim (HMG, for example), Dodgin' Skills (Dodger, for example), BLIND stat, running (there's a penalty for the shooter when his target is walking), Luck, and Line of Sight Broken.

The LoS is the straight line between the shooter and the enemy (the best way to look this line is when a Trooper is aiming). Example of LoS.

The penalty of a LoS happens when a Trooper is between the straight line of the shooter and the target, then, we can say that it's a Line of Sight BROKEN.

The concequences of a LoSB is some misses in the burst (I believe in an Aim reduction, I mean, the penalty is all about -XX % of Aim), and sometimes the burst changes for the Trooper in this line.

So, the Skill Blind Fury counters a Line of Sight Broken. (I said before that I believe in -XX % when the LoS is broken based on this Skill. I mean, if it counters BLINDness, -50% Aim, all LoS penalties would be nothing less than -XX % Aim).

Example of a LoSB. This guy shot through his comrade, missing ONE bullet.

Back to Brick S__t, , my conception of "and anyone behind <Trooper> will benefit from added cover " is the owner of this Skill will increase the act of "broking the LoS".
I mean, BSH ones break easily a LoS, and the penalty will be greater than usual. Follow me??
(take a look on photos and coments in the wikia: Brick S**tHouse)

My comentary was too long, though ... But if anyone want to add something about what I said, re-write, correct me, discuss, feedback?, I would be glad with it, though .

Brick S__t gives +3 LP; we all know that. And pickupsticks is right. Is all about Line of Sight. I wrote somethings on wikia about LoS, and I'm going to post what I think about it, ok?

Think about a guy Aiming. There are two kinds of bullets: bullets that hits, and bullets that misses. The ways to miss some bullets are: low Aim (HMG, for example), Dodgin' Skills (Dodger, for example), BLIND stat, running (there's a penalty for the shooter when his target is walking), Luck, and Line of Sight Broken.

The LoS is the straight line between the shooter and the enemy (the best way to look this line is when a Trooper is aiming). Example of LoS.

The penalty of a LoS happens when a Trooper is between the straight line of the shooter and the target, then, we can say that it's a Line of Sight BROKEN.

The concequences of a LoSB is some misses in the burst (I believe in an Aim reduction, I mean, the penalty is all about -XX % of Aim), and sometimes the burst changes for the Trooper in this line.

So, the Skill Blind Fury counters a Line of Sight Broken. (I said before that I believe in -XX % when the LoS is broken based on this Skill. I mean, if it counters BLINDness, -50% Aim, all LoS penalties would be nothing less than -XX % Aim).

Example of a LoSB. This guy shot through his comrade, missing ONE bullet.

Back to Brick S__t, , my conception of "and anyone behind <Trooper> will benefit from added cover " is the owner of this Skill will increase the act of "broking the LoS".
I mean, BSH ones break easily a LoS, and the penalty will be greater than usual. Follow me??
(take a look on photos and coments in the wikia: Brick S**tHouse)

Poison damage is based on the real initiative you spend, instead of a fixed amount. Since the trooper has on point and he takes the twinoid right away, he'll get more than 500 initiative to counter the poison.

On march 27, 2013
Kompera

Consider it this way, Marco:

Taking Twinoid gives you 10 seconds (real time) of poison (the 10 seconds is an example, I haven't timed it)

If the game clock doesn't stop, you'll take 1 point of damage every 2 seconds of game time and real time until you've taken 5 damage. (Again, taking 1 damage every 2 seconds is an example. Twinoid does do 5 damage according to the wiki.)

But if you trigger an initiative boost which stops the game time clock, real time still counts against the duration of the poison. Stop the game clock for 10 seconds of real time and you won't take a single tick of poison damage.

On march 28, 2013
Doomys

Yeah that's not right.

The way propaganda works is at a 400, 800, 1200, etc time mark, a command will be given at random between all commands that have the right requirements (example: 2 troops in the reserve for support)

Propaganda requires that a trooper needs to be within punching distance. If that requirement is fulfilled, it will be in the command bracket and the game will throw a dice to determine what command will be used.


Not sure how clear this was. Feel free to ask for more details on the topic

[Disclaimer] Of course, this is also "only" a theory.

Marcotonio

Let's enummerate the deployment slots in this battle:

1 2
3 4
5

Actually, the deployment order is
2 5
1 4
3

Enemey spies are able to sneak in and grab any position in that order, so the real order of troopers will be changed, if enemy spy comes out without using Out Of Bounds

Ex:
a) if enemy spy grabs 1st spot then the order will have next the form
1 4
S 3
2

b) if enemy spy grabs 2nd spot then the order will have next the form
S 4
1 3
2

c) if enemy spy grabs 3rd spot then the order will have next the form
2 4
1 3
S

d) if enemy spy grabs 4th spot then the order will have next the form
2 4
1 S
3

etc

e) if enemy spies grab 1st and 3rd spots then the order will have the next form
1 3
S 2
S

etc

Kompera
Original_OtterHow do I destroy my army or stop my friend CONSTANTLY attacking my army?

You can't destroy it. But you can start a new army with all the knowledge you've picked up from reading these forums. Oh, and don't tell your 'friend' the name of this new army...

You cannot stop someone from constantly attacking your army with their three (or more, if they have certain skills) "Pick a Fight!" battles. The only real harm this does is to fill your Infiltrate battles with fights against him, which I'm assuming you will lose. This costs you 4 credits per day, and can add up over time.

Name the offending army, and you might get a bit of payback as others on this forum may attack him and fill his Infiltrate missions with a pile of much stronger armies and cost him the 4 credits.

Kompera

Questions / Discussions about Targeting

If you set your Trooper to target the Gut, and he has Heart Breaker, does that give a greater chance at a kill shot than setting him to target the Heart? After all, the Gut is a kill shot target, and so is the Heart.

If you have Heart Breaker or any high kill shot weapon (rifles), is there a down side to taking Vicious (aims for injured body parts), since that might draw your fire to an injured arm or leg rather than the kill shot target you had them set to target?
On may 14, 2013
[3483063]

My Theory:
- "I would say that a killshot is a chance of an instant kill when hitting certain body parts (Head, Lungs and Gut), that is defined by the critical chances of the Weapon with or without Skills."

You should stop reading by here.

I believe that you must target the Head and roll the chance of a killshot to perform it. I mean, if you hit the Head and the killshot doesn't rolls, it will just do the usual dmg. Then, if you target the Legs with a Long Rifle, for example, the chances of a killshot won't be the best.

The 1st question of Kompera, in my opinion, would have a sad answer, though. If this guy is using a Long Rifle (which has more chances of hitting the preffered body part), he won't benefit from Heart Breaker's bonus when hit the Gut.

About Vicious thing, I'm a believer that Vicious should only be used for damage. If a guy has a Long Rifle and Explosives, for example, a Injured body part will do a greater dmg, perhaps a kill. But when a Sniper or One-Shot-One-Kill dude has Vicious, he losts a precious bonus of preffered Aim.

My analisys of Killshot Skills and Weapon's Critical is quite vague, especially when talking about Weapons. The facts are that a Critical x5 is too low, and a critical x50 is very high, but how to explain the chances x20 of Lizaro and UMP?? In my conception UMP > Lizaro... But we cannot forget that the Assault Rifle has 3 bullets per burst, making the chances the triple of Lizaro in the analisys......

The Skills are pretty rare, but I've got some of them in my army (Sadly without nice Weapons). A Hydros analisys is very clear to everyone, though. The Critical chances of the used Weapon x4. A big diference for a Sparrow, a usual Critical for a Default Pistol. Heart Breaker is known by killing about 2~3 guys per battle. Voodoo Doll's Critical is almost forgotten because it's dmg increase, and Anatomy just do it. Doctors with AS and nice Skills are the best, IMO. Mine has only Hydros and Anatomy, Aiming for the Heart, and he do almost 3~5 Killshots per battle. Isn't insane, but it's beautiful to see.

Wrote a lot, holy crap, but cannot finish it without bringing BPV in the thread. I would choose easily BPV over FMB. It protects 3 body parts from Killshots. Don't know how it works exactly, -50x Critical or Critical-50%... Hard Boiled can do FMB's job better, without any Slot.

Really sorry about the World Trade Center text, I just got carried away... This text doesn't have any smiling faces and nothing.... ... b-o-r-i-n-g

If you guys want to see my Doc in action, (Anatomy + Hydros + Assault Rifles), take a look at http://satanas-jr.minitroopers.com/b/...~2~3... Don't ensure a well performance, but who knows... . Oh, the name of the Doc is Anjo Caido, btw.

On june 11, 2013
Kompera

It shuffles your equipment so you can try different combinations. You only get to use 3 equipment in any given battle, so it you have 4+ you'll see the re-equip button.

It only works if you choose to infiltrate a specific army base in the battle screen. When you do that, the link to the battle replay becomes a (semi) permanent link.

Kompera

If you really want it to be permanent, you'll need to download some video capture software. There are a few freeware products out there that'll do this for you.

If you rely on the Twinoid link, just be aware that they do clean-up every so often, and your 'permanent' link could last you a few weeks or a few months, and then be gone.
